Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Axel R
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 13 year old daughter in one room for four nights just after Easter and Marco and Serena are unique. Where else would your daughter be given an IPAD on arrival (which she kept for the whole duration of our stay), be greeted every late afternoon when getting back from visiting Rome to a complimentary glass of wine, beer or cocktail, where else is the complimentary mini-bar restocked every day, who else will recommend fabulous local restaurants to you (we tried five of these and they were all great and memorable in their own way),the best sights and how to get to them during your stay, how to avoid the cues at the Colliseum or the Vatican etc....and the list does not end there. I don't usually write reviews but for our hosts this is the least that I can do. After all, where else would the hotel staff want to call the manager on his day off so that he can personally say goodbye to you?

Reviews.Title: “4 enthusiastic thumbs up!!!”
Reviews.Author: vinceschiappi
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I stayed at the Deko Rome for a week of sightseeing in Rome. All the rave reviews are 100% true! Marco and Serena treated us like old family friends. Every day over wine or a cappuccino they provided specific tips to navigate Rome and provided us with superb reasonably priced restaurant recommendations (oh and they took care of getting us in). After a hard day of shopping and sightseeing, I would look forward to sitting down to a glass of wine and chatting. The rooms are spotless, the hotel is located in a very safe and convenient location. Marco and Serena's warmth and easygoing attitude really "set the tone" for our vacation. To put things in perspective, I will plan my next trip to Rome primarily around the availability of a room at Deko Rome. It's that big of a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Kheylar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April, 2012 and had a really great time. Marco and Serena were so friendly and helpful and really went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Marco gave us great tips for places to eat around the city and made reservations for us so we'd be sure to have a table. All of the places he recommended were excellent. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful and the room was spacious, impeccably decorated, comfortable and clean. The location of the hotel felt very safe and was an easy walk to a number of the great attractions in Rome (and not far from a square where you can jump on one of the hop-on/hop-off sight seeing buses). Overall this was a great place to stay and my husband and I both highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Yet another accolade”
Reviews.Author: Porkings
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the service we received at Deko. Serena and Marco were welcoming and helpful in any way we wanted but had the knack of being unobtrusive. We found their restaurant recommendations superb and they made the reservations for us!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly deserves the #1 spot”
Reviews.Author: Nelpiece
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a superb experience we had at Deko Rome. From start to finish it was just perfect. Marco and Serena are fantastic hosts and this is what sets them apart from the large hotels which you may be considering. Upon arrival Marco opened a bottle of wine for us to share whilst he annotated a map of Rome and highlighted the main attractions and also the best restaurants and bars in each area of the city. Going the extra mile like this totally made our trip as his recommendations were spot on. We celebrated our first wedding anniversary whilst we were there and wanted to try a small intimate restaurant for a romantic meal. Marco recommended Osteria del Pegno and it didn't disappoint. We also ate at Casa Coppelle the previous night which, too, was wonderful. Upon entering our room there was a bottle of Prosecco and chocolates waiting for us as well as a small bottle of fizz in the well stocked (and complementary!) mini bar. The room was modern and tastefully furnished. A real surprise was to find an iPad 2 in the room which was ours to use for the duration of our stay. I have never come across this before and was very useful. Free wi-fi is available throughout. The bathroom was very clean and the bed was comfy, if a little small (we're quite tall). Breakfast was good with croissants, fresh fruit, cold meats, cheese and fantastic coffee. Serena did a great job in ensuring we had enough. Throughout our short stay Marco was on hand to ask if we needed anything and offered us a glass of wine on several occasions. So to summarise, Deko Rome is the perfect place to stay whilst in the great city of Rome. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great personal service! Deko did it for us! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: skdcitraveller
Reviews.Content: We chose Deko Rome after researching TA as we would rather avoid the impersonal nature of a large hotel and like building our own short breaks. We couldn’t believe it was no.1 rated in Rome and wondered what it had done to earn such a high accolade. We made contact in hope rather than expectation that we could book it. We did book with 4 months notice and went last week in March 2012. We can see why it has earnt such a good rating after only 11 months in business. It would be very difficult to fault anything. Depending on what room (honeymoon suite, superior or deluxe) you book and when, defines the tariff. All I will say is that we made the right decision for making our trip extra special. We took advantage of Deko’s offer of a limo service pick up (€50)/drop off (€45) at Fiumicino which was about 40 minutes door to door. We were met downstairs by Marco who insists on carrying suitcases to the room. I guess we had to walk a hundred steps (almost all at airport) from airplane to Deko front door. The hotel is more an up market but informal bed and breakfast located near to the US Embassy, as well as a police station and a Spar, in a safe and smart area, 8 minutes walk to Barberini Metro Station. It is well located for walking to Spanish steps (8 mins), Trevi Fountains & Pantheon (15 mins), Victor Emmanuel, Colliseum, Roman Forum & Palatine hill (15-20mins). The Vatican Museum & St. Peter’s Basilica are 15-20 mins by Metro from Barberini to Ottaviano with short walks at each end (€1pp per trip). A few tips on booking Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel (suggest book on-line when at Deko to avoid queuing) and e-mail ahead to Marco to book Museo Borghese as it would have needed a 2-3 week advance booking when we were there. Deko is 60’s contemporary chic and very comfortable but undoubtedly the thing that sets it aside from impersonal hotels is the concierge +++ in the form of Marco and Serena. They have converted two apartments into a six bed room guest house. On arrival you are genuinely warmly greeted, seated and Prosecco thrust towards you and given the Deko welcome with a guided tour via tourist map of the sights to be seen, where to eat, where to avoid and other recommendations etc. It is a bit daunting when you first arrive as you are not orientated but by the end of your first day you have identified most of the locations he flags up on your map. If you have forgotten their significance just ask Marco or Serena when you get back and they will jog your memory. This young couple put so much into this place, 12 hour days, 7 days a week for 51 weeks of the year and it is paying off for those lucky enough to stay at Deko and receive their personal attention. I won’t say too much more about Marco and Serena’s customer service as I am sure you will enjoy the Rome briefing & bespoke welcome they provide as well as the genuine warmth they purvey to all their guests who arrive and leave on first name terms having made their trip to the wonderful City of Rome even more memorable. We enjoyed chatting with guests at breakfast and late afternoon as we talked through our days and shared some tips. Everyone was so chilled and polite. Deko must engender that feeling of relaxation on its guests. The rooms have good en-suite facilities including safe, hairdryer and toiletries. You have a daily replenished fridge with water, soft drinks, beer and Prosecco. Sky Italia TV and gratis internet access too. Can’t think of anything else we would have wanted. We had Room one (the smallest but perfectly adequate) then number three (larger). Both were on street side but quiet. Just a few tips, if like us you hadn’t been to Rome before, or at least not for many years……….. prepare with comfortable shoes! Most of the famous sites (as above) are within a 1-2 mile radius with the Vatican over the Tiber a bit further away (use the Metro). If like us you run out of steam on the fourth day, maybe take the open top tourist bus from St Peter’s and negotiate a hop on/off all day rate and sun bathe upstairs as you rest your feet! We went round two and a half times before we got off near Barberini! Won’t bother with separate restaurant reviews but following Marco’s advice we visited two of his recommendations and one that we had from home before we came. 1. Il Margutta (5 mins by taxi), One of the top Vegetarian restaurants in Rome (apparently). Nice ambience, décor & substantial menu with a Barolo wine probably the best I’ve ever had. Sadly we both found the food was bland and lacking in imagination with over reliance on lentils and artichokes. I like strong tastes and this didn’t do it for either of us. Too expensive and ostentatious. An easy way to spend €120 too! 2. San Marco (3 mins walk from Deco). We ate here twice in busy, large and vibrant atmosphere. Both times service and food was excellent. As we had eaten here on first night we chose this for our anniversary meal and both had Argentine steaks. Wow! Great with Multipulciano as well. Not much change from €100 but worth it. 3. Due Ladroni (7 mins taxi). A sea food restaurant in Piazza Nicosia. A recommendation from home but shut on Saturday lunchtime and all day Sunday so couldn’t eat here for our special occasion. We had sea food bruschetta followed by Lobster linguine and grilled scampi (langoustine in UK). Both mains were large offerings. All I can say if you are looking for a special meal with a good wine list then we will still be talking about this for years to come. Lots of Limoncello and other tasters thrown in after sweets so left very happy. No change from €140 so beware! All three of these restaurants are listed in TA and have their own reviews. A personal choice on our part but we like to give our honest opinions so that others can take a view and make their own minds up. A great trip to Rome made perfect with Marco and Serena’s attention to detail and hospitality. Enjoy Deko Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Rome's best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: Karen Mick W
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four days at the wonderful Hotel Deko in Rome, which we found on Trip Advisor. Our thanks to Marco and Serena for making our stay so special. They made us feel so welcome and at home, and thanks to their guidance, we got the best of both worlds with Rome - tourists by day and eating with the locals at night. The hotel is wonderful, clean, and tastefully decorated, and we very much enjoyed our glass of wine with Marco every afternoon when we came back from sightseeing with very sore feet! Serena made us a wonderful breakfast each morning that we never managed to finish. Thanks again to two wonderful hosts, and we hope to visit Deko again when we return to Rome. We would recommend this hotel to everyone - absolutely wonderful. Best Wishes Karen & Mick

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with friends; see Rome as a local”
Reviews.Author: IainWaugh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Deko Rome with my girlfriend Helen for 4 nights in March, on the basis of the excellent TA reviews. I'm so glad we did - I've never felt more welcome in a hotel anywhere. Marco and Serena are the loveliest hosts you can hope for. They will sit with you at check in and point out places of interest and their favourite restaurants and things to do with you on a map. From then on any question you have is never too much trouble, they will book restaurants or galleries for you and help you tailor your trip for maximum enjoyment. The hotel is more like a boutique B&B (they call it a guest house, which is playing it down) - our room (the suite) was wonderfully finished, stylish, clean and comfortable with an awesome shower and Sky TV. It's definitely worth the extra for the suite, you get a living room plus the bedroom. Plus, book direct with Deko as it is cheaper than via Booking.com or whatever. It's not as instant but Marco will get back to your emails quickly. Breakfast was generous and varied and plated for you each morning by Serena, you can have it in your room as well if you like. Each evening after a day's sightseeing Marco would welcome us back with a cheery "drink?", and pour a spritz, prossecco or cocktail before catching up after the day. Often other guests would be around too and we'd end up having an enjoyable discussion. The friendly atmosphere rubs off on everyone and helps avoid the occaisional awkwardness you can get in shared areas of hotels. We were lucky enough to go out for dinner with Marco and Serena on our last night and had a truly fantastic evening, it was the perfect end to a perfect city break. Ciao guys and see you again soon, next time we're in Rome (or if you ever make it to Bristol!)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lruckel
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the Deko Rome for 3 days and it was wonderful. As everyone has said previously, you couldnt meet two nicer people than Marco and Serena. They were available to give us guidance with where to eat and where to visit. They also helped us to negotiate the streets of Rome. It's a cool hotel - it's unique and we will be back.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terry S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Deko Rome for 7 nights - we can't say enough good things about Marco and Serena and their staff. The service is beyond excellent - they are helpful, caring people who are excellent at what they do. Their restaurant recommendations are perfect, and they are more than happy to help you with whatever you need. The hotel is small, beautifully decorated and in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Lilysm
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Marco and Serena adds personal touches to ensure your stay is comfortable. They will call for reservation, help with your baggage and accompany out the door upon departure. Very friendly service and very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, just perfect :)”
Reviews.Author: Johndoc11
Reviews.Content: Iv never left a review for anything in my life! Iv stayed in lots of hotels, hostels b&bs in my time but something about this hotel just wants me to tell people how good it is!!  Firstly... Wow,  Marco and Serena, Iv never met 2 nicer people who love what they do and who they do it for. Its not just amazing customer service, its more like a genuine friendship, these guys just want to look after you!! They will give you all the best hotspots to go in Rome,  I don't think I opened my guidebook once?haha! Also, the hotel itself is beautiful, rooms are spotless, funky,  all the mod cons you need! Breakfast was insanely good! The area is super safe and so close to all the hotspots in Rome! And of course complimentary Prosecco in the evening :) Amazing experience, thanks guy! John and Louise x

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Joanna A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Deko Rome for 4 nights over the marathon weekend. The service we received from Marco & Serena was brilliant. Advice on where to eat, shop, visit etc. The hotel is lovely and quiet, beautifully decorated and a perfect base. Can't recommend the Deko highly enough.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ocean Isle Beach, North Carolina, USA
Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Winston C
Reviews.Content: The room was most comfortable and the breakfast/snacks very good, but the most deserved accolades go to the staff. They were unfailingly helpful and courteous,the facilities were brilliant - great room, coffee/tea makings facilities and bottled water refreshed every day. enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: mus09
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Deko Rome - comfortable, clean room (BIG bed) and such great service from the owners Marco and Serena that by the time we finished our stay we felt we'd made real friends. Nothing was too much trouble, from recommending good places to eat and to visit, to arranging cars and guides and making restaurant bookings. Yummy breakfast platter and excellent coffee. I had a birthday while there and found a bottle of fizz in our room as a gift from our hosts. Don't expect full hotel services as it is more like a B and B but it suited our needs perfectly. It is in an upmarket and quiet area of Rome and within easy reach of transport systems, shops and all the things you want to see. We will be telling all our friends about it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Yilin T
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Deko Rome. Best of all the 6 hotels we stayed in throughout our 16 days in Europe! Marco and Serena were such great hosts! They advised us on almost everything we needed to know to get around Rome and they were upset on our behalf when they found out we got cheated by a rogue taxi driver who charged us more than 4 times the normal price. Nothing was too much hassle. Knowing it was our honeymoon, they provided us with a complimentary bottle of prosecco. Even the well-stocked minibar was complimentary, as was the great homemade breakfast daily! I know it doesn't make sense to watch tv on holiday but the amazing selection of channels including animal planet and national geographic blew us away! We'd definitely stay here again if we were in Rome and would recommend it to all our friends and family! Thanks so much, Serena and Marco!

Reviews.Title: “exeeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Dvir H
Reviews.Content: My wife, our 1.5 old Baby & myself arrived for our 1st Rome visit. I really feel lucky that we were able to get one of the 6 rooms in this great place, as you read, the owners are really nice people (& very helpful of course). The personal touch is felt everywhere, & it's really noce for those of you who are looking to stay away from the big unpersonal places out there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel excellent hosts”
Reviews.Author: KathleenM03
Reviews.Content: We couldnt fault our stay at Deko, Marco and Serena made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived with Serena making us a coffee then sitting down with us and a map pointing out all best places to visit, they arranged taxis, booked restauraunts, nothing was too much trouble, they are perfect hosts. Our room was spotlessly clean and had everything we needed including a mini fridge which was restocked daily and was free. We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary while there and they left us a bottle of Prosecco in the room which was a lovely surprise. Breakfast was also very nice with a selection of musli, yoghurt, fresh fruit, cheese, cold meats, cakes and pastries, fresh juice and wonderful coffee. Located in a nice area and walking distance of all the attraction I would recommend this small hotel to anyone visiting Rome, my husband has stayed in many hotels through his working life and said this was the best place he has ever stayed and its the owners and staff that make it so.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Good people, Good fun.”
Reviews.Author: Scott G
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Son ( 15) and I spent 10 nights at Deko Rome in December 2011. Marco, Serena and team went out of their way to make us feel at home, from Serena marking up a map of sights and dining, to drinks with Marco most evenings to discus what we had been up to. They were happy to make dinner and lunch reservations for us, and book transport to the airport on our last day. The three of us were comfortable in the room, with a single bed provided for our son, and all the places reccomended to eat at, including a resturant in Florence were fantastic. Breakfasts provided were substantial, with crosaints, sliced meats, fruit and biscotti to start the day, as well as juice and coffee. Good value, good people, good fun. We look forward to staying there again when we next visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great People, Great City!”
Reviews.Author: CzechInside
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Deko Hotel was outstanding! From the pre-arranged pick-up at the airport (price comparable / better / safer than a taxi) that Deko set up, arrival & greeting by Marco that evening, daily breakfast & conversation with Serena, the unparalleled service provided, to our departure, was all top-notch! This is a boutique hotel, so please keep that in mind when choosing to stay here. That said, the quality & intimacy of service provided far exceeded any hotel I have stayed at (traveled to over 45 countries & stayed in numerous hotels, B&B, etc. over the past 15 yrs). Staying at the Deko was more like staying with good friends than in a nondescript or chain hotel. Both Marco & Serena know Rome very well & can provide suggestions for just about anything you have in mind. This also includes numerous suggestions for restaurants, clubs, sights, etc. that only locals or those “in-the-know” might have info on. As for the hotel & rooms, again, very nice. The rooms vary in size, but all are well equipped with basic essentials, very clean, & a nice place to lay your head after a long day of seeing the sights. More than likely, Marco or Serena (or both) will be there when you return to ask how the day went & offer up a nice glass of wine, espresso/cappuccino, or juice to relax with. The location of the hotel is very easy to navigate the city from. There is a police station located 10 meters down the street, and the U.S. Embassy is located across the street in the other direction (again, providing for a very secure environment with police & Embassy guard presence). There is also a taxi stand about a 1 minute walk up the street. If you feel like going by foot, most sights are within a 15-30 minute stroll / walk, which also provides you the ability to explore all the side streets & neighborhoods you would not see if traveling by taxi or metro. All in all, this is a great place to stay and will just further enhance your experience while in Rome. I would definitely recommend to anyone and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: LAXTraveler24
Reviews.Content: I've stayed all over the world, and while you won't confuse the Deko with a Ritz or a Mandarin Oriental, I felt more comfortable at the Deko than at some of those properties. Unless you need an in-hotel restaurant or spa for your Rome visit, you'd really be crazy not to stay here. The room was large, comfortable, well-appointed with everything you'd need (satellite tv, safe, a/c, FREE minibar, internet...) the bathroom was large, with new sinks, shower, toielt, bidet; the decoration was hip yet welcoming; the location ideal; and finally Marco and Serena treat you like lifelong friends. They know the city, and go out of their way to help you find whatever it is you're looking to do in it. This place is a bargain right now, and eventually it will cost more. It has to, because the service provided is just too valuable. I just hope when that day comes, nothing else changes. Because it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugs0312
Reviews.Content: The best and warmest experience we have ever had in a hotel. As everyone mentioned in their reviews, this is a personalized service that exceeds anyone's expectations. My expectations were high, and still were exceeded. This is not about the room, or facilities, which are perfect, modern and impecable, instead it is about the way they make you feel while in Rome. Just imagine you are visiting friends that happen to be the sweetest people in the world, are helpful, thoughtful and have excelent taste. We tried almost all the restaurants they recommended and all were outstanding, and believe me, we are very critical when it comes to judging a meal. They receive you with a smile everyday, not matter how tired they might be, which by the way, feels real and genuine. They do anything to help, anything. An example: we called one afternoon because we were a little lost looking for a pub Marco recommended and needed some help, he immediatelly guided us to the right way and since we were close to another good restaurant he knew, made reservations for us and called me back on my US cell phone to confirm, the restaurant was incredible. They usually have breakfast from 8am to 11am, but since our taxi was picking us up at 8 am, Serena came earlier to make sure we ate something before we left, then she walked us down just like she would their friends. Oh, for Valentines, they left us a bottle of Proseco and and a card. Again, thank you Serena and Marco, we had a lovely stay. We will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: PH93
Reviews.Content: We just concluded a week in Rome at Deko Rome and it was wonderful. Keep in mind, this is not a typical hotel. It is just 6 rooms, but feels like you are staying with friends. Marco and Serena are so helpful and really care about your enjoyment of Rome. If you are up for something different, I hily recommend staying at Deko Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie mille Marco and Serena! Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: helenc0902
Reviews.Content: It is hard to know where to begin as there are so many fantastic things to say about Deko Rome. The best part is the people – Marco and Serena are the most amazing hosts! They are warm and incredibly helpful and make the Roman experience something really special. We were there last week (Feb 2012) for four nights and enjoyed every single moment. Marco had arranged a taxi pick up from the airport for us and, upon arrival, he greeted us with a smile and a glass of wine! He proceeded to go through a map of Rome with us, in detail, not simply highlighting the tourist attractions (which we did want to visit) but specific streets and areas of interest. He also gave us lots of information about restaurants and bars and either he or Serena would ask us each day where we would like to eat that night and make a reservation. All the restaurants were amazing, serving truly Roman food. We even went to a small bakery in Campo di Fiori one afternoon (Forno) just because Marco had recommended it. Each day, when we returned from our sightseeing, Marco would welcome us with a glass of wine or Prosecco and ask us about our day. He and Serena are passionate about their city and about what they do and they genuinely want to make your stay as personal and enjoyable as it can be. Deko Rome is in a great location. There is a taxi rank two minutes walk away, the metro (Barberini) is about 10 minutes walk, and very handy for getting to the further sites, such as the Colosseum and Vatican. There are some excellent restaurants close by (top tip – take Marco and Serena’s advice regarding where to eat!) and we walked almost everywhere, day and night. Our room was contemporary and stylish and immaculately clean. And nice and quiet at night, although we would usually return late after several glasses of wine and Amaretto! A number of other visitors have mentioned the details that make Deko Rome stand out – free WiFi, free mini bar, plentiful continental breakfast (served 8-11am, although they are completely flexible!). If you are looking for a large corporate hotel with a spa, pool, concierge and anonymous service, then Deko Rome is not for you. If you want to experience genuine, warm Roman hospitality which will ensure you experience the best of Rome, then you will not find anywhere better than Deko Rome! Grazie mille Marco and Serena! We will return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Your Personal Trip Advisor in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LadyOLeisure
Reviews.Content: I thought I posted a review last Fall, after we returned from our Italy trip, but checking my contributions and skimming past reviews, it appears I forgot! That is a travesty! We reserved our week's stay in Rome at Deko Rome before they ever opened their doors. I had scoured Trip Advisor for reviews of "guest houses" and B&Bs, because I've had good luck doing that before. When following up on a recommendation for a nearby B&B (that was already booked for our week), they gave me the names of several other accommodations, including Deko Rome. The response that came back from Marco was brimming with anticipation about their planned opening, and after a couple short email exchanges through which he answered all our questions, we booked a full week for Sept 9-16. If you've read all the glowing recommendations here, you are aware that Deko Rome is clearly a successful enterprise for Marco and his charming wife, Serena. I have never felt so "at home" or so well taken care of at any hotel or guesthouse anywhere in the world. Every transportation question, directions, restaurant or shopping recommendations, or even silly problems with the way the toilet seat fit in the bathroom, were answered with confidence and smiles and the attitude that if you need this, it will be done! The quiet location was delightful...the AC invaluable (September was SO hot!) and the complimentary mini-bar refrigerator was fantastic. One night, we just wanted to chill out and eat a sandwich in the "cafe" area. They got us plates, glasses, silverware and napkins to use. (We'd picked up supplies a couple doors down) We were careful to clean up after ourselves as the place was ALWAYS spotless. The evening wine & chats with Marco, Serena and other guests provided some lovely memories. Oh yes, and we also appreciated the free wifi. Clearly, if we ever have the opportunity to visit Rome again, Marco will be our first contact. It would be like staying with family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: kirsten k
Reviews.Content: For our first bvisit to Rome me and my wife we decided to stay at Deko and it was the perfect choise! Specially if you never been in a big city as Rome is you need all the Serena´s tips about the city, restaurants to go, museums and good shops, I mean all not touristic places then better!!! Serena she made our stay perfect, the room was very nice and very clean, breakfast amazing!!! When in Rome go there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Deko”
Reviews.Author: rahanna
Reviews.Content: This review is way overdue as we stayed at Deko Rome in September 2011 but Marco and Serena were such gracious hosts that it would have been remiss of me not to compliment them on TA. My husband, our one and a half year old and I were in Rome at the end of August (staying at a different hotel) and as we were off to other parts of Europe before our final leg back in Rome, Marco and Serena were kind enough to keep some of our luggage until our return to stay so that we would not have to lug it around. From the very moment we got to Deko (Marco helped arrange our airport pickup for Euros 50 so do be sure to ask if you need to), we were made to feel at home by the friendly couple. They helped with our bags and took us up to our room which was a little small but completely comfortable, modern and sufficient. It probably felt a little smaller as we had 2 big suitcases in the corner! The location is convenient, just off Via Veneto - easy walking distance to many places, restaurants close by, safe and there is a supermarket a few doors down if you need the essentials. Marco and Serena made restaurant recommendations and we had meals in 3 of them and were very, very happy. They made reservations for us and nothing was too much trouble. There is a pizza place within walking distance (I forget what it's called) that had good food and a fabulous tiramisu! Our son had big smiles for Serena who chatted away with him in both English and Italian and from whom he picked up a very cheery 'Ciao'! In a small establishment such as the Deko Rome, it is often the people who make the place and in this case, Marco and Serena definitely do. They are a lovely couple with whom we were very comfortable and whom we wish well. We enjoyed our pre-dinner wine and vodka with Marco who shared stories about himself and life in Rome. We were very happy with our short time here and if we find ourselves in Rome again, would definitely stay. Marco and Serena, thank you for your hospitality and we hope to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Just like visiting friends or family in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GLaslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Deko Rome for 2 nights in January. Because we wanted to see as much as we could during our short stay in Rome we did not spent a lot of time at the hotel, but the time we had there was perfect. From the beginning we felt like home, just like visting friends or family in Rome. You get a lot of attention from the young couple that is running Deko Rome. Marco en Serena will give you a warm welcome, give good advice about Rome and places to vistit. The hotel ( or some people would call it bed&breakfast) is not big, a few rooms but that is why your stay there is so personal. It is in a building in a very safe and quite street. The room was spacy, modern and clean. Free Wi-Fi and mini-bar! To get to the hotel that is on the second floor of the building you can take the stairs or a funny "retro" lift. There is a taxi-place just around the corner and we thought the taxi`s not so expensive (besides that it can be an adventure itself going by Italian taxi:-)) We were happy that we stayed at Deko Rome. The location, place and service were just perfect. Advice for Rome: The streets of Rome will kill every women high-heeled shoes so just make sure that you take some sneakers.

Reviews.Title: “NEW CONCEPT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: michelle c
Reviews.Content: Travelling around the world I've stayed in a lots of hotels but I've never stayed in something similar. Deko Rome is different first of all because Serena and Marco, they made our stay incredible making us feeling at home; almost every day we had an aperitif for free and they recommended us the best restaurants all around the city! The room was very clean and modern with free wi fi, international tv channels, free minibar and free breakfast, all things that almost in all the others hotels we've stayed are extra charged!! I'll stay again at Deko Rome when in Rome..

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Rome”
Reviews.Author: chernova_st
Reviews.Content: For several days I went to Rome to my friend Katherina, she lived and studied there at the institute. I stayed near her flat at Via Veneto at the Hotel “Deco Rome”. My room was modern with grey tiled floors and flat-screen TVs. Deko Rome is set in a 20th-century building. It is 200 metres from the exclusive shops and restaurants along Via Veneto. In my room I had a radio, safe and individually controlled air conditioning. I also had free Wi-Fi, a minibar and a private bathroom with a hairdryer, slippers and toiletries. Rome Deko served for me a continental breakfast each morning. The Spanish Steps are 10 minutes away on foot. The beautiful gardens of Villa Borghese are 500 metres away. Nearby great bus and metro links. My impressions are excellent!

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: kily t
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Rome and I couldn't ask for a better place to stay!! At Deko Rome everything was perfect, great hospitality, great breakfast, great room perfect cleaned every day!! the thing that was impreesive were the hosts, marco & Serena made our stay perfect, we felt as two romans inRome even if it was only our first time there! They suggested us the best place to go out for dinner, after dinner and during the day!! Thx guys to make our stay so perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Make our stay really enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: jasoh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Deko Rome during my nov trip to Italy. It was a very good choice. Location was reasonable walk to Spanish steps and Trevi fountain, the owners was very friendly and helpful with places to eat, tips for taxi rides and visiting of places of interest. Breakfast were specially prepared every morning with pastries, cakes, cereals with milk, juices, toast, cheese, ham, fruits and yogurt. Too much for me but there is a variety for each guest. Would definitely go back if I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “It's true: this is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ENDEAVOURMORSE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a week here. Before arriving we were worried that reviews had hyped this hotel beyond what it deserved. We know now they hadn't; it's a very, very nice place to stay. The primary reasons are the staff (who couldn't be friendlier or more helpful) and the location (behind the USA embassy, a block or so off the Via Veneto). That said you need to know it's more of a B&B than a true hotel. If you want amenities and services you won't find them here. Instead you get a small, intimate haven from the city's chaos. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: travel810
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location, Outstanding service, spotlessly Clean, New and Modern. I travel a lot and normally stay at the big 5 star hotels, my friend whose birthday it was wanted to stay at a smaller hotel so we decided on Deko. I am so glad we stayed there. Marco and Serena were wonderful; it was like having your own private concierge who took time and served wine or cappuccino. When we returned from our day they would offer us a drink, prosecco, or cappuccino and then sit with us to help us decide where to eat. There was a taxi strike while we were there and Marco was still able to get us a private car to the airport. One other nice touch was the mini fridge was stocked with water, coke, wine and there was no charge. Very nice little, personal hotel!

Reviews.Title: “NOT A HOTEL..MUCH MORE!”
Reviews.Author: serenissimat
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife we've been there three weeks ago!! We quickly found Deko Rome outstanding, Serena welcomed us with a big smile and she offered us a great cappuccino..after that she explayned us all about the city; main spots and place to go to eat; we followed all her recommendation and we felt like an italian in a big touritstic city as Rome is!!! There it was everything perfect and if ìwe will come back to Rome we will definately come back at Deko Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deko: Super friendly and amazing service”
Reviews.Author: topptur
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, super friendly staff, great location and very nice rooms. We loved the breakfast! After arriving the Deko Rome we received a brilliant introduction to where & what to do in Rome. I wish every hotel could give this service. I've never experienced this good welcome at a hotel before. Our room had exactly what we needed. It had a cool decoration, very clean, free mini-bar and the size was just right. The location of Deko is perfect; in a nice, safe and trendy area, close to shopping street and only 10 minutes walk to Spanish Steps. A walk in the park is only a few minutes away. What makes this place stand out is its staff and their extra friendly and helpful service. Wish we could have stayed more than only 1 night. We will come back here next time we are in Rome, and we recommend you to do the same. Conclusion: This is simply the place to stay when in Rome. I think the place is especially great for couples and young people travelling to Rome for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Base”
Reviews.Author: Jen R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Deko based on the trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed. The location was perfect, near the train station, near the Metro station, and close to the Spanish Steps. While the rooms are clean and the breakfasts are great, the number one reason to stay at this hotel are Marco and Serena. They arranged a driver to pick us up at the airport, greeted us with tea on arrival, and made all of our restaurant recommendations at wonderful places we would never have found on our own. As indiciated in other reviews, you are greeted with a warm welcome the moment you arrive and every time you pass through their doors. Their service is unparalled. Especially for first time visitors to Rome, this hotel is not only a great home base, but the best of Italian Hospitality and better service than a 5 star hotel conceriege.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, fab hosts”
Reviews.Author: NinaB796
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for new years eve and stayed at Deko Rome for 3 nights. Before we went, marco was in contact by email with suggestions for dinner for NYE and also booked a cab for us from the airport which was waiting for us when we arrived. When we arrived, Marco and Serena could not have been more welcoming, offering us a drink and then serena sat down and marked out a map for us with all the places to see and recommended restaurants. Every restaurant they recommended was good and not touristy at all. The location of deko Rome is great, we walked everywhere and didn't need to get the bus or metro anywhere. You can walk to the colosseum and Vatican easily, as well as all the other sights including Trevino fountain, pantheon, main piazzas and Spanish steps. Everyday when we came home in the afternoon from sightseeing marco offered us a coffee and we would sit at the bar with him and have a chat. Before going out for dinner he would offer us a glade of red wine to have with him which was lovely. Marco and serenade really are the perfect hosts and we never experienced service like this in a hotel or b and b. The rooms are nice, modern and clean. Only negative is that they are all off the reception so sometimes you could hear the conversations outside your door when people came back and had a drink at the bar but this didnt bother us and it was very quiet at night or in the mornings. The breakfasts were huge- too big in fact and I felt bad each morning with the amount of food I wasted. Perhaps a better idea would be to let guests help themselves to whatever they want as I couldn't eat cakes and biscuits for breakfast so wasted them every morning whereas I would have preferred to have much more hams and cheeses. The free mineral water everyday was a nice touch and they even left us a bottle of prosecco and a pannetone on new years eve which was lovely. We weren't told the rest of the contents in the mini bar were free which would have been nice to know, we only found this out later when reading reviews on this website. We would def stay at deko Rome again, purely for the excellent service, thanks marco and serena.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: JessinItaly_10
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect--not far from termini and metro stations, down the street from Spanish steps, around the corner from the Borghese gardens, and across the street from the US embassy complex. The staff is tremendous! I travel to Rome fairly often as I am an expat living in Italy, and I can say this is the most helpful, professional, caring staff I've experienced yet! I also may literally laminate the tourism map that the staff marked up for me with lots of authentic restaurants, places to get a drink, where the locals can be found, daily plans depending on my mood etc., because I have always found it very difficult to get a good meal or a drink with a good atmosphere in Rome since it's such a tourist and tourist-catering saturated city. I will recommend Deko to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss.”
Reviews.Author: jake f
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend here for her 18th birthday. Surreal, utterly speechless. Thank you for providing the best possible vacation and memories.

Reviews.Title: “Just like staying with friends....”
Reviews.Author: AntoniaPC
Reviews.Content: From start to finish our stay here was memorable. Marco and Serena are charming. They made us feel very welcome and were full of good advice about Rome, especially which restaurants and bars to visit! The hotel is clean and chic and in a great location for discovering the magnificent sights of the city. We cannot wait to go back to explore some more, and we will definitely be staying at the Deko again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place in an amazing city..”
Reviews.Author: Jayney2540
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister as she booked a suprise holiday for me. When I arrived I did not know what to expect.. My sister rang the bell and within seconds Marco was there to collect our suitcases!! We were greeted at the top in the hotel by serena who made me feel at home straight away.. The hotel is perfect..everything you could ask for in every single way.. Clean, retro, minimilistic, warm and serena and marco just make it !! Everyday rooms cleaned to perfection, breakfast was superb and always greeted whenever arriving or leaving the building..Did not want to go home and will certainly be returning next year.I recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to have superb accommodation whilst staying in Rome.. 11 out of 10 !!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hosts”
Reviews.Author: Onyxsoleil
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip to Italy in October. Our first stop was Rome. We stayed at Deko Rome based on the rave reviews of TripAdvisor. The hosts, Marco and Serena, were so helpful and nice. They sat down with us upon arrival and went over the map of Rome with us. They were full of suggestions and helpful tips. It was great to have this help since it was our first time. The hotel was a little hard to find, my suggestion would be to take Marco's suggestion on transportation if you are coming from the airport, it is faster and easier to use their transportation they arrange. The location worked perfectly for us, we were a few blocks from the Metro/subway and a few blocks to catch a bus. Plus, the restaurants in the area were plentiful. We went running in in the Villa Borghese Park in the mornings, it is huge but so peaceful to run in. It is 5 minutes from the hotel and I would say it is a must see. The only negatives to the hotel would be the noise level of other guests can be a factor. It would depend on how respectful late night guests are in regards to their noise levels. It seems we could hear full conversations as if they were in our room. The other issue is the small bathrooms, shower is great but incredibly small and no real storage space in the bathroom. Overall, we had a good experience. Marco and Serena are two truly genuine people that want their guests to have the best experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Clean, Comfortable and a Friend”
Reviews.Author: Whtbox
Reviews.Content: When first arrived Rome, we find it difficult to find the hotel. At the end we found it, because the Hotel is part of the Commercial building on 2nd floor. We were greeted by Marco and Serena when arrived and it was such a welcoming feeling. Marco really take his time to explain where to eat, how to get around and to aware the problem around Rome cities. Serena help making an ample supply of Breakfast which we never be able to finish, because it's alot. All the place Marco and Serena, recommended to eat was amazing. I have been happy with all the restaurant they recommended. The location of the Hotel is great, with Despar (Groceries store) just next door and of course a Police station as well. Travelling to sightseeing is also not very far. Can just take the 116 bus pretty much stop to all nearby places and also 10 minute walk to Barberni Metro as well. Out of all, we have made a friend with Marco and Serena. We are very happy with their service and friendliness have provided for us on our honeymoon. I will recommend all my friends if they go to Rome, should stay at Deko Rome! Once again thank you Marco and Serena, for the amazing Hospitality you have provided. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Randall4867
Reviews.Content: While I've never stayed in an office building, parts of which are converted into hotel rooms, this worked out well. Convenient location for walking to many sites and the hosts were very nice people. Would stay here again because of them.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed and wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: bibakoop
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Deko at the end of October was just perfect for what we needed. Excellent location. Walking distance to everything you need and in a good part of town. Easy to get around. But the really fantastic part was the wonderful service. That is what makes this place a gem. Marco and Serena looked after us so well. They went out of their way to be helpful to us with everything and made us feel very comfortable. My husband was on a break from work and we stayed with our 2 year old. Marco and Serena were so accommodating and we fell in love with our afternoon spritzer and it was so easy to relax after a long day and meet the other guests because of the wonderful intimacy this place has to offer. This place made our last night in Rome just perfect and we will definitely be recommending to our friends! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Gail K
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel in a great location, Marco and Serena made it feel like we were coming home at the end of each day. Their lunch and dinner suggestions were incredible and I appreciated that they previewed restaurants before suggesting them. Consequently, we never even had an average meal -- all were exceptional. The room was comfortable and beautifully decorated. We will stay there every time we go to Rome. I have already suggested it to several people and am sure they will love it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “"Deko is simply the only place I would/will ever stay in Rome!"”
Reviews.Author: ben_hicks
Reviews.Content: Where do I start about my stay at Deko......there are just to many great points to say about it! My fiance took me to Rome for a surprise birthday, and Marco and Serena the owners of Deko Rome made it even more special for us. Their understanding of our wants and needs for our 4 days there was spot on, showing us on the map the "local" restaurants that they go to, not expensive but special. A glass of presecco every evening with them to toast our day and the supper that was coming. The breakfast was excellent,furit, cakes, meats,toast and excellent coffee! A simple but perfect way to set you up for a lovely walk before hitting one of the many restaurants near to Deko. The room was beautifully presented, and what you would expect from a 4/5 star hotel. If on business, with friends or a romantic trip away I will always return to Deko to see Marco and Serena again, they make the role as hosts look effortless....simply because they enjoy and take so much pride in how they run Deko. A huge Congratulaions and Thanks to them for making it my best birthday to date. We will see you soon. Ben & Geri xxx

Reviews.Title: “Deko Rome Guest House”
Reviews.Author: paulmiles
Reviews.Content: I as many before read the TA comments before I left for Rome. I also read the information on their website http://www.dekorome.com Why some are complaining confuses me, Marco has clearly stated that Deko Rome is a guest house. If you wish for warm company, nice clean attractive rooms, and VERY helpful staff Deko Rome excels. Nothing was too much trouble for Serena or Marco, they are both superb hosts that try extra hard to make your stay enjoyable. If your looking for a large bar area, or restaurant within the facilities you will need a Hotel... This is a Grade A guest house, with lovely people. Its unusual, its different, in a positive way The Good Location is great short walk to. Trevi Fountian ( walk) Spanish Steps (walk.. close to Trevi) Vatican ( tube.. metro 4 euros) Coliseum (taxi 7 euros) Palatino (NEXT to Colisuem ).. Borghese Gardens (very close walk) Also quite handy a SPAR supermarket TWO doors away.. very useful for last minute supplies. Fav Resraurant... SAN MARCO ... close walk also Harrys Bar Best restaurant street :- Via Vittorio Veneto (close walk) We also went to Leonardo Shopping Centre on last day (V Close to airport) NICE shopping centre. Food is pretty good everywhere, we had one poor meal, that was probably just a one off bad night. The room we had was excellent, spacious and clean NUM 6 The Negatives As a guest house, not many negatives, Marco and Serena do their best for you, its all about what you want, this is not a Hotel, its more like staying with friends, you can come and go as you please, and breakfast is very flexible time wise, as long as you go prepared to act under your own Initiative you will love this place. If like myself you are unfit, I would recommend walking TO your chosen attraction, as most are downhill, and get a Taxi back ... approx 7-10 euros from most places. To walk back to Deko from Colisuem is pretty tough after a long days sight seeing.. Restaurants, Trust Serena and Marco.. they know the area well, and will book tickets for attractions and Restaurants.. What Would I Change ? Personally I would like to see SKY UK or USA satellite, nearly all TV is Italian dubbed, its not important , but would help enhance the stay a little more. Would I got back ? Yes I would, and I have already recommended Deko to some friends, I prefer the no nonsense approach of Marco, you get exactly what you would expect.. great hosts, lovely room, good location. Whatever you ask for you will get.. JUST ASK !!

Reviews.Title: “Still number one!”
Reviews.Author: svbur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent several nights at the Deko Hotel at the end of October. Marco and Serena were exceptional hosts. The breakfast was beautifully presented and delicious as were the afternoon spritzer and snacks he treated us to. The bathroom and decor were up to the minute in design. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was quiet even though on a street. The hotel is across from the American Consulate and an easy walk to many parts of Rome. The restaurants Marco suggested were ones we never would have found otherwise and were memorable. This is definitely the best place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a captivating city”
Reviews.Author: Ascotman
Reviews.Content: The Deko offers a very special kind of experience. Its created by the wonderful hosts Marco and Serena. They care in a way that is very rare these days. They were genuinely interested in making our visit to Rome and not just their hotel, fantastic for us. They took time to ensure we had everything we needed to enjoy each of our three days in the City, providing us information on sites, shopping and restaurant recommendations a well as booking tickets in advance when it was advisable to avoid the queues. Before we had even left home for our trip Marco had made contact to offer to arrange transport from the airport and to check we had everything we needed. It was an indication how much effort they put into making everything hassle free. The hotel itself is elegantly simple, very clean and comfortable. Its in a historic and interesting building and the experience of staying there connects you to the city in a way that a large commercial hotel cannot. The room we had ( and from what I could see they were all very similar) was a good size, with great fitments, excellent air conditioning and nice big soundproofed window to watch the world go by. Sure, there is a bit of noise occasionally from the street after 7 in the morning but that just adds to the character of the place. Oh, yes, and I would have liked some toast for breakfast but that's just me! If you have soul and adventure you'll love this place. Your choice..........

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Kaycarter
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights at the Deko Roma hotel in November. It was a fantastic trip, the city was brilliant with lots to see and do, more than you can see in 3 days, and the hotel was equally as excellent. The hotel is in a great location - only 10 minutes walk from the Spanish steps, and near to the metro for getting around Rome. The rooms are lovely, spacious, modern and clean, and with 6 rooms there is a more personal feeling than you find with large hotels. However the highlight of the hotel are the owners, Marco and Serena, they really go out of their way to make sure you have a truly fantastic trip. When we arrived Serena spent ages talking to us about the city, recommending places to visit, things to do and places to eat. We tried a few of her recommended restaurants and they were all amazing! If you visit here you must try the restaurants that Marco and Serena recommend, you will not be disappointed! In the evening Marco and Serena offered to share a few glasses of wine with us and talk more about our trip to Rome, they made sure we had everything we needed, including booking a table at the restaurant or calling a taxi - it made us feel very well looked after. I have stayed in lots of hotels and I can honestly say the service at the Deko Roma is the best. Anyone who is planning a visit to Rome should really consider staying in this hotel, it is fabulous, and we had a fantastic stay here. I would love to come back to Rome again, and when I do I will be back to this hotel. Thank you Marco and Serena for a brilliant stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Rome of 'La Dolce Vita.'”
Reviews.Author: DonnyKLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: In the 60's, 70's and 80's our October sojourn in Italy always started in Rome. My wife and I would sit on the stairs of our leased apartment in the Piazza Navonna and absorb its essence, We would stand on the terrace of our hotel at the top of The Spanish Steps and ingest the tranquility, history and purely Roman experience long after sightseeing was the reason we were there. Year after year we watched Rome morph from the Rome of Sophia Loren and Marcello Mastroianni, Gregory Peck and Audrey Hepburn, to the Rome of tour buses, queues of tourists dutifully following placards and visitors cramming into piazzas like commuters cram into homebound trains at workday's end in Manhattan. We understood that Rome must be seen, but we had had enough. Last month, after a 15 year respite, spoiled by our higher budgets when younger, but no longer willing to pay exorbitant rates for a pleasant place to sleep, we started our trip in Rome again. An article about the Deko peaked our curiosity, and after lovely EMAILs back and forth, we booked for 5 days. The hotel arranged to have a taxi meet us when we landed.. The young owners, Marco Cardillo and Serena Piccolino lease 2nd floor space in a building off the Via Veneto.The location is superb. They have parsed the space into 4 rooms and a suite. The rooms are modern, fresh and clean. The bathrooms elegant and comfortable. The atmosphere is pristine and uncomplicated.. The breakfast is sufficient. Their company, however, one of the primary reasons one comes to Italy in the first place. They are both so sweet, caring and so Roman. Our trips will start in Rome once again, our Rome primarily being the square half kilometre bordered by the Borghese Gardens, Via Sistina and the length of the Via Veneto. We will venture out into the gardens, head toward the Tevere, walk along its quay down to Trastevere and roam around the periphery of the inundated streets, knowing we'll be returning to our lovely space at The Deko and the wonderful Marco and Serena. dk.. .

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Gordon_Bennett_NZ
Reviews.Content: The first thing I read are the bad reviews; I figure they will be the most honest reviews. In this case, while they may be technically right, they are very unfair. Having stayed for two nights recently with my 84 year old father, after a whirlwind trip round 15 countries, Marko and Serena and their guest house was not only the best stay by far, but as the last stay on our trip they rounded off our trip perfectly. It's true they are not a hotel but to my mind that is a bonus. It's true also the lift is old, but it worked perfectly well for us. And yes they weren't on the premises 24 hours a day, but that was no problem and they supplied a phone number for emergencies. Nothing was too much trouble and they were genuine in their approach, a far cry from the 'service' at most places. The price is very reasonable - make the comparisons - but if you want the anonymity of a hotel and enjoy being treated as just another person by someone who really doesn't give a damn as long as you tip, go elsewhere. I'm a budget traveller who enjoys being spoiled, I'm no tycoon and I'm unimpressed by luxury. For me the service I experienced was the best I've had in all my years of travel - which has encompassed 55 countries and places from 5 star hotels to shacks with holes in the roof. I'd recommend them without question; I'm only afraid that success will take them places I can no longer afford. And I fell instantly in love with Tania, but that's another story. Thank you Marko for a wonderful stay and your welcoming attitude and thank you Serena for all your advice and the parting gift. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely home from home”
Reviews.Author: PamBurn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Deko Roma on the occasion of my husband's 65th birthday and we were delighted that we had chosen them. Their passion for what they do and for their lovely small boutique hotel is apparent in everything they do. NOTHING is too much trouble - they booked a restaurant for dinner in the evening of my husband's birthday, having been given broad guidance from us - what a wonderful choice they made! We had one of the best meals we have ever had anywhere at PierLuigi's and they made sure the restaurant knew it was a special occasion too so we had very special treatment. From our arrival to our departure, Marco and Serena made suggestions, offered help, booked cars, restaurants and tickets for the theatre for us - they could not have done more and everything done with a smile and an eagerness to show us their city and make us comfortable in their hotel which is a little gem, it really is. My husband and I have spent many years living abroad and we have travelled very extensively all over the world, on business and leisure, staying in many different styles of venue from five star hotels to tents up in the Himalayas. If you want personal service with a genuine care for your needs and wishes, you could stay in none better than Deko Roma whilst in Rome. We wish Marcos and Serena all the luck in the world in their venture - they certainly deserve it. And thanks again, both of you, for a very special few days.

Reviews.Title: “Deko Rome is Delightful”
Reviews.Author: grmm3
Reviews.Content: We chose Deko Rome for our first visit to Rome based on the outstanding reviews on Trip Advisor. We had originally booked with another boutique hotel but changed our reservation after reading all the great reviews and checking out the neighborhood where Deko is located. We are certainly glad we made the switch. The place was outstanding. The hosts were even more outstanding. Marco, Serena, and Monica are among the most pleasant hosts/hoteliers we have ever experienced. We felt more at home at this hotel than we have at many B and B's throughout our travelers both in the US and Europe. As soon as we arrived, Marco made us feel welcome and gave us a drink and an orientation guide to Rome and its restaurants which quickly dispelled any first visit anxiety. Based on our later experiences, his recommendations were right on, especially his advice about getting around Rome and Rome restaurants. We had one of the best meals on our trip at the great little restaurant recommended by both Marco and Serena----Casa Copelle. Our room was clean, modern, and large by European standards. We do not like stuffy or frilly hotel rooms, and our room at Deko was the antithesis of such rooms. Both the room and the bath were minimalist chic. The breakfasts each morning prepared by either Marco, Serena, or Monica were generous and interesting with fresh fruit, yogurt, croissants, chocolates, pastries, and cold cuts. The coffee, of course, was great. If we return to Rome, we will definitely stay at Deko Rome again. The place is simply that good in a city with over 1,200 hotels. Be sure to try Casa Copelle for lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Best inn in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 42travler42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Deko Rome for 2 nights in late October, 2011, as everyone said, Marco and Serena are the greatest host. know how to treat their guests. Marco emailed me a couple weeks before our arrival, offering to arrange to have a private car pick us up from the airport . They were also most gracious in providing us something to drink when we first arrived, Marco and Serena shared all their favorite restaurants and gave us a great overview of Rome while we were sipping on our welcoming specialty drink made by Marco. Serena shared her favorite places to SHOP near the hotel. The breakfast was yummy and it was fresh the coffee was amazing made fresh. We Loved the location and the fact that American Embasy is across the street, Police station is located on the same block also supermarket right next door. Thanks Marco and Serena!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “DEKO ALL THE WAY”
Reviews.Author: BROOKLYNGIRLS
Reviews.Content: The best 2 days ever.Marco & Serena are the greatest host. We were at home at all times. They gave us mumbers to call if we needed them after hours they lived just blocks away,we never needed anything. We could never eat all the food offered at breafast it was so much food.and it was fresh ,the coffee selection was amazing they made everything fresh. They made all our reservations for Dinner we ate at Risterante Pierluigi for dinner and We felt that because Marco made the reservation for us we were seated in there best location, service and the food is 12 stars. They arranged all our transfers from the airport to DEKO, from DEKO to the port and the price quoted was the cheapest ,everything was great ,the Drivers were on time and great drivers. When we had a question about the room description MARCO took care of us no questions asked great customer service. We will always stay there whenever we caome to Rome. We loved the fact that the American Embasy is across the street. Police station is located on the same block also supermarket right next door. We felt very safe and secure. Walking distance to a lot of attractions. The room was very modern and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “We had a fantastic stay; quiet location away from the tourist crowds”
Reviews.Author: shinobirastafari
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay here, and found that both Marco and Serena were most generous with their advice on things to see and places to visit. They were also most gracious in providing us something to drink when we first dropped by. After spending some time near the Spanish Steps, we also found that staying in a quiet neighborhood (near Via Veneto, the US Embassy, and Villa Borghese) was a welcome respite. Will definitely stay there again if we get the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “A home while away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Turntheheatdown
Reviews.Content: Deko is not a hotel; it is much better than that. I have just returned from a five night stay with my wife celebrating our silver wedding anniversary. I am HHonors Diamond and tend to favour large Hilton hotels (they didn't lose out since we ate in La Pergola at the Cavalieri which was a tremendous experience) where I know what I am getting and generally I am very well looked after. I took a chance on Deko given the occasion and I am so glad I did. From the chauffeur in his Mercedes meeting us at the gate to Marco running upstairs while we and our luggage were in the lift everything was done in such a personal way. Both of us felt throughout as if we were staying with good friends who know when you need something and also know when to leave you alone. The location is superb. The care and attention beyond compare. The Aperol and prosecco spritzers restorative. If you want to be completely detached and have a clinical stay in Rome don't come here. If you are looking for something that is the complete opposite then do. I have never known a hotel owner to firstly offer (actually it was Marco who offered!) and then to take the time to do my wife's make up on two nights (Serena is a professional make up artist) before we went out for dinner. It was wonderful. As we left at 8 in the morning Serena told us that Marco had left a note to call him since he was up late checking in guests and was having a long lie but he did not want us to go without again thanking us for coming and staying with them. I could write a lot more but instead of using them I will just use the word to encompass all...........superlative. Long may they thrive. My concern is that the CEO of a large hotel group may pay Marco and Serena a fortune to imbue in his or her hotels the customer care that comes to them so naturally in their very upmarket guest house.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: SwissScot
Reviews.Content: Made to feel most welcome, with nothing too much trouble for the owners, good breakfast to start off your day, great location. Definitely listen to Serena's advice on places to eat! Overall a lovely comfortable place to stay where you are made to feel like a personal friend by Marco and Serena. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary Z
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from Boston to Rome we were warmly welcomed by owners Marco and Serena, as well their staff person, Monica. While our room was made ready (we were several hours early for check in) they fed us juice, tea, fruit, ect. Then Marco took one of his maps and spent about 20 minutes marking the off restaurants, and points of interest. The hotel is small, six rooms, which are very nicely appointed. This allows them to give top-notch attention to thier clients. They are professional but friendly at the same time. My friend had researched hotels very thoroughly in Rome and we were so pleased we chose this one. Marco or Serena would arrange taxis, get tickets to different sites and make other very helpful suggestions. I feel they made our stay in Rome that much more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: farce_mayfly
Reviews.Content: I can only confirm everyone else's comments - this is a great place to stay. I had a couple of days in Rome on my own and Deko Rome was the perfect haven. It's stylishly and comfortably decored, is within walking distance of the major attractions, great restaurants and shopping but there are also multiple bus routes that stop almost outside the door (if you have walked so far, that you just can't face the walk back up the Via Veneto at the end of the day.) Marco and Serena are generous with their advice, have lots of great recommendations, and as Serena says, are passionate about what they do. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Class Service in Modern, New Boutique Hotel in Safe, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: DJDinKC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Deko Rome for 4 nights in late September, 2011. It was our favorite hotel during our Italian vacation. We would stay there again without considering any other place if we are so fortunate to return to Rome in the future. It is clear from past reviews that whether you are as happy with your experience as we were depends on what you want and expect out of your hotel experience while visiting Rome. Deko Rome is NOT a full service, luxury hotel with 24 hour room service and staff, a pool or workout facility, and an on-site restaurant or bar open late in the evening or early in the morning. If those services and resources are important to you and what you are expecting, you may want to consider booking at such a hotel. However, for the reasons below, our stay at Deko Rome will be a treasured memory that we wouldn’t trade for any of the luxuries or services offered at the 5 star, full service hotels. The owners, Marco and Serena, and their assistant Monica, set Deko Rome apart, and made our stay at the hotel a unique and memorable experience. It is clear they sincerely want to get to know their guests, and eagerly take the time to do whatever they can to ensure that their guests have the best experience possible while exploring Rome. Other reviewers hit it on the head when they described a stay at Deko as staying with friends in a well appointed apartment. Marco, Serena, and Monica are not formal, do not address you by your last name, and do not dress in the uniform’s you find in a luxury hotel chain. Instead, they are informal, dressed in clothes befitting their young age, and interact with their guests much as they would with their friends. Even though I booked the room through Agoda (see edited version of review on Agoda), Marco emailed me a couple weeks before our arrival, offering to arrange to have a private car pick us up from the airport. When we arrived, Marco was upset that we had not buzzed him in advance so he could have helped us carry our luggage up the stairs. Despite one reviewer’s opinion, we liked the old-fashioned lift, and had no complaints using it. It definitely is an old fashioned, quaint, lift. However, we found it charming, with sufficient room for our two huge, over-stuffed duffel bags. If someone is so tired they don’t want to take the 3 flights of stairs to Deko’s floor, the lift works perfectly, even if it moves slower than the modern elevators. Again, it all depends on a traveler’s expectations and standards. I would also take a different view of comments that there is no reception or concierge at Deko. I travel a fair amount for business, and we are fortunate enough to be able to vacation a couple times a year, occassionally splurging at luxury hotels. We felt that Marco and Serena were more helpful, and spot-on with their restaurant recommendations, and places to see, than any other hotel in which I’ve stayed. We also did not have any problem with the fact we were on our own after Marco and Serena left late in the evening. We made sure that if we wanted extra towels or supplies, we asked for them before they left. But we knew before arriving that we were not staying at a hotel with a staff on site 24 hours a day. I rarely, if ever, order room service or have a need to contact the hotel staff once I’m in for the evening. If you value that level of service, you may want to consider booking at a different hotel. The service and advice that Marco and Serena willingly offer is more sincere and personalized than I’ve received at well known 5 star hotels. As the other reviewers have noted, when we checked in, Marco shared a complimentary drink of our choice while he showed us on a map his favorite tourist attractions and sites, and his favorite restaurants. I highly recommend following Marco’s restaurant recommendations. We dined at 4 of the 5 recommended restaurants, and each meal was fantastic, reasonably priced, and busy with many more locals than tourists. Marco and Serena recommend restaurants that they go to when they get a chance to eat out. At the end of the day, when we returned to Deko, Marco and Serena wanted to hear about our experiences as we shared a drink at the little bar in the breakfast area off the lobby. The hotel is not in the middle of the crowded tourist sites, or within throwing distance of the Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc. For us, however, Deko is perfectly situated because it was an easy 7 to 10 minute walk from the Spanish Steps and a Metro and bus stop to take you to any spot in Rome. Yet the neighborhood is quiet, peaceful and secure. The hotel is located in a safe area, a block from the U.S. Embassy and the police station. You need a key to enter the historic building in which Deko Rome is located, and you need a second key to get into Deko’s reception and rooms. The hotel is only 3 blocks from the Villa Borghese, the equivalent of New York’s Central Park. If you are in Rome on a Sunday and have time, we highly recommend strolling through the park to mingle with the locals and their families taking boat rides on the ponds, picnicking, and riding bicycles. The hotel is new and the rooms are decorated in a modern style, with the newest conveniences, such as fog-free bathroom mirrors, electronically controlled flat screen T.V’s and AC. The pictures on the hotel's website and from the TA reviewers accurately show the condition and decor of the lobby, breakfast area, and rooms. The rooms are quiet, with heavy curtains shutting out any noise from the outside. We booked the junior suite (the room with a picture of an elephant as seen on the hotel’s website), which had a large living area with a large couch, in addition to the good sized bedroom and king sized bed (as oppposed to the more typical arrangement of pushing together two twin beds). The bathrooms were relatively large, with great water pressure and shower doors to keep the floors from getting soaked. The room and bathroom were spotless and sanitized each day. Because we paid for an all-inclusive rate, the water, juice and prosecco in the mini-fridge was included in our rate. Monica, who is as sweet as Marco and Serena, helped prepare at least one of our breakfasts, and should be applauded for keeping the rooms so clean. The breakfasts are typical of many other Italian hotels, and varied little each morning. But there was more than enough food, including cereal, yogurt, croissants, cheese, ham and bread (to make a sandwich), toast and jam. You can order a variety of juices and coffee made to your likeing. The cappiccinos were great. If I was going to nit-pick, and try and find areas for improvement, I’d suggest that Marco and Serena add a dresser or armoire to increase the storage space in each room. Our room had a standing closet with room to hang a few items of clothing, but there was nothing to store our clothes if we wanted to unpack for our stay. Also, when you book your room, you may want to call Marco or Serena and ask if the room is adjacent to the breakfast area. When breakfast was being served, you could hear the voices and meals being prepared through the walls. It didn’t bother us, because we were getting up by around 8 or 8:30 to get started on our day. But if you plan on sleeping in, it may be worth asking for a room set away from the breakfast area. In conclusion, we knew the sort of hotel we were looking for, and found it. We could not have known, however, that we’d meet hotel owners and staff that clearly enjoy getting to know their guests and doing all they can to ensure their guests have a wonderful experience while visiting Rome. Thank you Marco, Serena, and Monica, for making us feel welcome in your wonderful city. Daryl and Lynne

Reviews.Title: “5 star customer service”
Reviews.Author: KingswayCallie
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience some of the best customer service in Europe then you have to stay at Deko Roma! From the moment your cab pulls up to the door, Marco and Serena will go out of their way to make sure that your stay in Rome is amazing.
